aligned_sections.original_content: 1.1 Scope of Work: The Provider agrees to perform the services for the Client as detailed in the Statement of Work ("SOW") attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference. Any changes to the SOW must be made via a written change order executed by both Parties. 1.2 Independent Contractor: The Provider acts solely as an independent contractor. This Agreement does not create any partnership, joint venture, employment, or agency relationship between the Parties. 1.3 Governing Law: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the internal laws of the State of Delaware, without giving effect to any choice or conflict of law provision or rule.
aligned_sections.amended_content: 1.1 Scope of Work: The Provider agrees to perform the services for the Client as detailed in the Statement of Work ("SOW") attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference. Any changes to the SOW must be made via a written change order executed by both Parties. 1.2 Independent Contractor: The Provider acts solely as an independent contractor. This Agreement does not create any partnership, joint venture, employment, or agency relationship between the Parties. 1.3 Governing Law: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the internal laws of the State of Delaware, without giving effect to any choice or conflict of law provision or rule.

aligned_sections.original_content: 2.1 Term: The initial term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for a period of twenty-four (24) months, unless terminated earlier pursuant to this Article II. 2.2 Termination for Cause: Either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice if the other Party materially breaches any provision of this Agreement, and such breach remains uncured for a period of fifteen (15) days following receipt of written notice specifying the breach. A failure to pay fees when due constitutes a material breach. 2.3 Termination for Convenience: The Client may terminate this Agreement for convenience upon providing sixty (60) days prior written notice to the Provider. Upon such termination, the Client shall pay the Provider for all services rendered up to the effective termination date, plus any non-cancellable expenses incurred. 2.4 Suspension of Service: The Provider reserves the right to suspend the Services if the Client is more than fifteen (15) days overdue on any payment invoice. The Provider shall provide written notice of suspension, and the Services will resume promptly once all overdue payments are received.
aligned_sections.amended_content: 2.1 Term: The initial term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for a period of thirty-six (36) months, unless terminated earlier pursuant to this Article II. 2.2 Termination for Cause: Either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice if the other Party materially breaches any provision of this Agreement, and such breach remains uncured for a period of thirty (30) days following receipt of written notice specifying the breach. A failure to pay fees when due constitutes a material breach. 2.3 Termination for Convenience: The Client may terminate this Agreement for convenience upon providing ninety (90) days prior written notice to the Provider. Upon such termination, the Client shall pay the Provider for all services rendered up to the effective termination date, plus any non-cancellable expenses incurred. 2.4 Suspension of Service: The Provider reserves the right to suspend the Services if the Client is more than fifteen (15) days overdue on any payment invoice. The Provider shall provide written notice of suspension, and the Services will resume promptly once all overdue payments are received.

aligned_sections.original_content: 3.1 Fees: The Client agrees to compensate the Provider at a fixed monthly rate of 15,000 USD, payable in advance on the first day of each calendar month. All undisputed fees must be paid within fifteen (15) days of the invoice date. 3.2 Late Payment: Any undisputed amounts not paid when due shall accrue interest at the rate of one and a half percent (1.5%) per month, or the maximum rate permitted by applicable law, whichever is less, from the due date until paid.
aligned_sections.amended_content: 3.1 Fees: The Client agrees to compensate the Provider at a fixed monthly rate of 18,000 USD, payable in advance on the first day of each calendar month. All undisputed fees must be paid within fifteen (15) days of the invoice date. 3.2 Late Payment: Any undisputed amounts not paid when due shall accrue interest at the rate of two percent (2.0%) per month, or the maximum rate permitted by applicable law, whichever is less, from the due date until paid.

aligned_sections.original_content: 4.1 Definition of Confidential Information: "Confidential Information" shall mean all non-public information, including, but not limited to, trade secrets, financial data, business plans, and source code, disclosed by one Party to the other, whether orally or in writing. 4.2 Non-Disclosure Obligation: Both Parties agree to use the Confidential Information of the other Party solely for the purposes contemplated by this Agreement and shall exercise the same degree of care to prevent its disclosure as the receiving party uses to protect its own similar information.
aligned_sections.amended_content: 4.1 Definition of Confidential Information: "Confidential Information" shall mean all non-public information, including, but not limited to, trade secrets, financial data, business plans, and source code, disclosed by one Party to the other, whether orally or in writing. 4.2 Non-Disclosure Obligation: Both Parties agree to use the Confidential Information of the other Party solely for the purposes contemplated by this Agreement and shall exercise the same degree of care to prevent its disclosure as the receiving party uses to protect its own similar information.

aligned_sections.original_content: 5.1 Mutual Indemnification: Each Party (the "Indemnifying Party") agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the other Party (the "Indemnified Party") from and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, and expenses arising from any third-party claim alleging the Indemnifying Party's gross negligence or willful misconduct in connection with this Agreement. 5.2 Provider Warranty: The Provider warrants that the Services will be performed in a professional and workmanlike manner in accordance with generally accepted industry standards. This warranty shall expire thirty (30) days after completion of the respective Service.
aligned_sections.amended_content: 5.1 Mutual Indemnification: Each Party (the "Indemnifying Party") agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the other Party (the "Indemnified Party") from and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, and expenses arising from any third-party claim alleging the Indemnifying Party's gross negligence or willful misconduct in connection with this Agreement. 5.2 Provider Warranty: The Provider warrants that the Services will be performed in a professional and workmanlike manner in accordance with generally accepted industry standards. This warranty shall expire thirty (30) days after completion of the respective Service.

aligned_sections.original_content: 6.1 Exclusion of Damages: Except for claims related to breach of confidentiality or indemnification, neither party shall be liable to the other for any special, incidental, punitive, or consequential damages (including loss of profits or data), even if advised of the possibility of such damages. 6.2 Cap on Liability: The total aggregate liability of the Provider to the Client for any and all claims arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be limited to the total fees paid by the Client to the Provider during the "three (3) months" immediately preceding the date the claim arose.
aligned_sections.amended_content: 6.1 Exclusion of Damages: Except for claims related to breach of confidentiality or indemnification, neither party shall be liable to the other for any special, incidental, punitive, or consequential damages (including loss of profits or data), even if advised of the possibility of such damages. 6.2 Cap on Liability: The total aggregate liability of the Provider to the Client for any and all claims arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be limited to the total fees paid by the Client to the Provider during the six (6) months immediately preceding the date the claim arose.

aligned_sections.original_content: 7.1 Force Majeure: Neither Party shall be held liable for any delay or failure in performance due to events beyond its reasonable control, including but not limited to acts of God, war, terrorism, or strikes. 7.2 Notices: All notices required or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed delivered when delivered by certified mail or reputable overnight courier. 7.3 Entire Agreement: This Agreement, including all attached SOWs, constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties and supersedes all prior agreements, oral or written.
aligned_sections.amended_content: 7.1 Force Majeure: Neither Party shall be held liable for any delay or failure in performance due to events beyond its reasonable control, including but not limited to acts of God, war, terrorism, or strikes. 7.2 Notices: All notices required or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed delivered when delivered by certified mail or reputable overnight courier. 7.3 Entire Agreement: This Agreement, including all attached SOWs, constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties and supersedes all prior agreements, oral or written.
